alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 12:28AM EDT until May 02 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey... Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr affecting Morris County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rockaway River At Boonton Below Resvr. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Flooding occurs on Vail Road in Montville. The Road heading into Parsippany is subject to closures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 4.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 5.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 5.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 5.0 feet on 12/01/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (2 am) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Rockaway River Boonton Below R 5.0 4.8 Sun 11 p 4.9 4.4 5.0 2pm 5/01 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 1200 PM EDT.
